intro: Bunchosia ursana, commonly known as the Mexican elderberry, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature, often used in traditional medicine. Bunchosia ursana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and along stream banks.
